ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An alternate_product_relationship is a an association between two products whereby one product, the alternate product, may be used in place of another product, the base product.
If one product is an alternate for another product it is understood that there is no interest to keep track of which product, the base or any alternates specified, is used as a particular instance of the base product within a product structure.
An organization may track design changes for a base part, and establish effectivity conditions for the use of that base part in various assemblies to be manufactured. The use of an alternate product implies that an organization does not specify any particular version of the alternate product or establish effectivities relating to it.
An alternate_product_relationship for which the base product is an assembly specifies that the entire product structure of the alternate product may be used in place of the base product and its product structure.
Two bolts of the same size are products. One bolt has a square head and the other has a hexagonal head. These head shapes are properties of the respective products. The two bolts are considered equivalent with respect to form, fit, and function: they both have sufficiently close physical shape, they take up the same space when used, and they both serve to fasten two things together. Thus, one of these two bolts could be considered to be an alternate part for the other bolt.
The relationship established by the alternate_product_relationship need not be symmetric. If B is an alternate product for A, A is not implied to be an alternate product for B.

the
by which the alternate_product_relationship is known.

the
that characterizes the alternate_product_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
a product that may be used in place of the base product.
a product for which another product may be used as an alternate.

ext_description.p: a text description to specify the rationale and criteria used to consider the alternate product in place of the base product.
ext_description.example: In the alternate_product_relationship for the two bolts defined in example 1, the value of the basis attribute, could be "head shape", while the value of the definition attribute could be "alternate for use as fastener in engine assembly".

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The instance for the alternate product shall not be the same as the instance of the base product.
The combination of the alternate product and the base product shall be unique.

An assembly_component_usage is a type of
that should be used to establish a relationship between product_definitions within one of the following three product structures:
bill-of-material (BOM) structure;
In a BOM structure,
entities represent nodes and
or
entities represent links.
parts list structure;
In a parts list structure, a
entity represents the root node. The
entities represent nodes at each intermediate level of the structure. The
entities represent links to higher-levels of the structure.
promissory use structure.
In a promissory use structure,
entities represent nodes, and
entities represent links between the nodes.
In order to allow for extensions to this entity in other parts of ISO 10303, the SUPERTYPE clause of this entity is only partially explicit. If the subtypes defined in this part of ISO 10303 were a complete categorization, the SUPERTYPE clause of this entity could properly read:
SUPERTYPE OF ( ANDOR ONEOF (, , ))
An assembly_component_usage relates a constituent to its assembly. An assembly_component_usage may be either a , or a , or a .

ext_description.p:
a distinctive code that serves to identify the usage of the
as a component in the
in a diagram, list, chart, or on a physical piece of equipment. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
ext_description.note: The reference_designator attribute can be made mandatory, or constrained to be unique, or both, in an annotated EXPRESS schema that uses or specializes this entity.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An assembly_component_usage_substitute is a specification of that one constituent can be used as a substitute for another within the context of a given assembly.
The assembly context is specified by the fact that both assembly_component_usages referred to by the base and substitute attributes reference the same
in their inherited
attribute.
The instance of the substitute constituent does not require the same spatial relationship or the same quantity. A substitute constituent does not require equivalent form, fit, and function of the constituent for which it is a substitute.
This entity defines one-way substitution only. Within a given context, if A is specified as a substitute for B, B is not implied to be a substitute for A.
The assembly_component_usage_substitute entity may be used to eliminate the re-identification of all higher-level assemblies when a new version of a lower-level constituent is created.

the
by which the assembly_component_usage_substitute is known.

the
that characterizes the assembly_component_usage_substitute. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

an
for which the substitute may be used.

an
that may be used for the base.

The
attribute of both the base and the substitute attributes shall refer to the same assembly .
The base and substitute attributes shall not be the same instance.
The combination of the base and substitute attributes shall be unique.

An assembly_component_usage_substitute_with_ranking is a type of
that specifies a relative preference value for the usage of a particular constituent as a substitute for another among all substitutes within the context of a given assembly.

an integer that ranks the preference for use of the substitute
among all assembly_component_usage_substitute_with_ranking instances with the same value for the base attribute. This value is an integer that only has meaning when comparing it with corresponding values for assembly_component_usage_substitute_with_rankings sharing the same base . It is a relative ranking value, not an absolute ranking. A lower value indicates a higher preference for the substitute , and a higher value indicates a lower preference.

ext_description.p: text that describes the rationale used for the ranking.
ext_description.example: Examples of ranking_rationale are cost and long lead time.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A make_from_usage_option is a type of
in which one product is the result of applying a process to another product.
Machining, plating, and bending are processes used to make another product.
In situations in which a product is made from another product using a sequence of processes, the intermediate products will be related using the make_from_usage_option entity.
A product to be modified may be an assembly. Generally, the
differs from the make_from_usage_option in that the constituents of an assembly are used in the assembly without any change.
A
may be the
of many make_from_usage_option relationships, and a
may be the
of many make_from_usage_option relationships. Further, there may be multiple make_from_usage_option instances referencing the same
and
pair of product_definitions.
Consider the case of a shaft that can be machined from either a casting or a forging. All three, the shaft, the forging, and the casting, are represented by separate instances of . Two instances of the make_from_usage_option entity exist, one between the
shaft and the
forging, the other between the
shaft and the
casting.

an integer that ranks the preference for use of the
among all make_from_usage_option instances that have the same value for the inherited
attribute. This value is an integer that only has meaning when comparing it with corresponding values for make_from_usage_options sharing the same . It is a relative ranking value, not an absolute ranking. A lower value indicates a higher preference for the , and a higher value indicates a lower preference.

ext_description.p: text that describes the rationale used for the ranking.
ext_description.example: Examples of ranking_rationale are cost and long lead time.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the amount of the
that can be made from the .
If the quantity of the constituent is expressed numerically, its value shall be greater than zero.

A make_from_usage_option_group is a collection of
instances that defines one possible combination of product_definitions that can be made from another single .
The make_from_usage_option_group is used to indicate that several different products may be made from a single product.
To represent the single product constraint within a single make_from_usage_option_group, the
of all of the instances of the make_from_usage_options shall be the same.
Suppose a bar stock, represented by
D, can be cut twice so as to create three - product_definitions, X, Y, and Z. The make_from_usage_option_group representing this situation would aggregate three make_from_usage_options as shown in Table 1:
id
quantity
1 X D 1
2 Y D 1
3 Z D 1
It is possible to use a product to make more than one combination of other products.
The same bar stock
D can be cut to produce two product_definitions X and one
T. In this case the corresponding make_from_usage_option_group would aggregate two make_from_usage_options as shown in Table 2:
id
quantity
2 X D 2
1 T D 1
A single
instance may be part of multiple make_from_usage_option_groups.

a collection of at least two
instances whose
instances may be made from the same .

All instances of members shall refer to the same instance of
in their respective
attribute.

A multi_level_reference_designator is a type of
that specifies the relationship between an assembly and a constituent if the assembly is not the immediate parent for the constituent and there are several hierarchical levels between the assembly and the constituent. The hierarchical levels are defined by a list of s that identifies a connected path in the assembly structure.
The multi_level_reference_designator is used to identify a specific instance of a component within a multi-level assembly structure for which certain properties are to be associated.
specifies the ordered list of connected s that defines an unambiguous path from the assembly to the constituent.
specifies the node in the assembly structure where the path starts.
specifies the node in the assembly structure where the path ends.
The location shall be unique across all instances of multi_level_reference_designator.
The list of s defined by location shall be connected.

For each lement in the location list the attribute
shall be provided.

A next_assembly_usage_occurrence is a type of
that specifies the relationship between a child constituent and its immediate parent assembly in a product structure.
An instance of next_assembly_usage_occurrence represents an individual occurrence of a constituent in an assembly. Each specific use of the same constituent may be represented by another distinct next_assembly_usage_occurrence instance for the purpose of assigning property information such as a position and orientation for the constituent. Property information is not provided by any of the entities of this part of ISO 10303 but by using the appropriate capabilities defined in ISO 10303-42 [1], ISO 10303-43 [2], and ISO 10303-41. The representation of a constituent occurrence in an assembly may be linked to mechanisms in ISO 10303-42 [1] and ISO 10303-43 [2] by means of a
entity defined in the product_definition_schema in ISO 10303-41.
The position and orientation of a constituent with respect to its assembly would be computed using a transformation defined in the representation_schema in ISO 10303-43 [2].
An application algorithm can produce an indented parts list for a product by sequentially tracing through a structure of next_assembly_usage_occurrence instances. A similar algorithm can be used to calculate the position and orientation of each occurrence of every constituent relative to its higher-level assemblies within a BOM when used in conjunction with the property information constructs defined ISO 10303-41, ISO 10303-42 [1], and ISO 10303-43 [2].
The number of constituents used in the assembly may be specified by composing a complex instance of next_assembly_usage_occurrence and .

The combination of
and
shall be unique within a population of next_assembly_usage_occurrence.

A product_definition_occurrence_relationship is an association between a
and an
in which the
referenced by the occurrence attribute is a specific instance of the constituent
referenced by the
attribute of the occurrence_usage in the assembly
referenced by the
attribute.
The identification of the specific instance of the constituent in the assembly can be defined using the
attribute of the
entity.
A product structure for a car is defined in which entity instances of
are defined for the chassis and the wheel. Four
instances are then created to represent the four wheels of the chassis in which the
has values of ‘left front’, ‘right front’, ‘left rear’, ‘right rear’. To represent specific information about the right rear wheel, a
of the wheel is created to which the information can be associated. To specify that this
is representing the wheel that is implied by the instance of
with the
attribute value of ‘right rear’, the product_definition_occurrence_relationship is created to associate the
with the .

the
by which the product_definition_occurrence_relationship is known.
the text that provides further information about the product_definition_occurrence_relationship. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

the
that represents a specific instance of the product.

the
that represents a specific use of the constituent in an assembly.

The
referenced by the occurrence attribute shall not be the assembly
in the
referenced by the occurrence_usage attribute.

The
referenced by the occurrence attribute shall not be the constituent
in the
referenced by the occurrence_usage attribute.

The
referenced by the occurrence attribute and the
that represents the constituent of the
shall be definitions of the same .

A product_definition_usage is a type of
that specifies a directed association between two product_definitions in which the
is used in the context of the . The product_definition_usage establishes a relationship stating that the related product is used in the context of the relating product. This usage is established for the life cycle stages and application contexts in which the two products are described.
The assembly trees established for production sometimes contain more intermediate levels than the trees established during the design phase. In such a case, the design phase relationship between a component and the assembly in which it is contained may be replaced by several intermediate relationships during production.
A given product may be used in a support role with respect to another product. A screwdriver may be identified as a resource to be used for the maintenance life cycle stage of a given product. In such a case, the support resource relationship between the screwdriver and the product for which it is identified to be used for maintenance activities may be specified.
If four identical bolts are used to attach two plates, there may be a need to identify one specific bolt for some purpose. It needs to be torqued to a greater degree than the rest. The inherited
attribute then is used to identify this specific bolt's requirement, even though all four bolt product_definition_usages will have the same attribute pair of product_definitions.
A product_definition_usage may be either a
or a .

ext_description.p:
Each product_definition_usage shall not relate the same
instance of
to the
or any of its descendants formed by their reference as the
in a graph of product_definition_usages.
ext_description.note:
This rule uses the function
defined in the product_definition_schema in ISO 10303-41.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
The combination of the inherited , , and
attributes shall be unique within a scope of product_definition_usage.

A promissory_usage_occurrence is a type of
in which the
is in the assembly tree of the
regardless of the number of intermediate levels between them.
A promissory_usage_occurrence is used when the product structure is not completely defined. In such a situation, it is still possible to relate an assembly to a constituent to capture the intent that the constituent will be used in that assembly.

A quantified_assembly_component_usage is a type of
that establishes the relationship between an assembly and one of its constituents if there is a need to specify the quantity of the child constituent used in the assembly.
Generally, for production planning or material planning purposes, several occurrences of a constituent are lumped together, and a quantity is specified to account for the several occurrences. A typical example would be the specifying of an occurrence of a rivet used for joining aeroplane structures and denoting the number of such rivets used on the entire aeroplane. If each of the occurrences of the rivets used is to be specified, the
entity may be used. As many instances of the
as the number of occurrences of the rivets will exist in this case.
a measure that defines how many or how much of the constituent is used in the assembly.
If the quantity of the constituent is expressed numerically, its value shall be greater than zero.

A specified_higher_usage_occurrence is a type of
that specifies the relationship between a constituent and an assembly if the assembly is not the immediate parent for the constituent.
The relationship between the constituent and the assembly of the specified_higher_usage_occurrence to be specified is captured by the relationship of the inherited attributes
and .
The two attributes (upper_usage and next_usage) within the primary instance of the entity specified_higher_usage_occurrence shall respectively specify an
and the
that together will provide the definition of the path from the constituent to the assembly for which the specified_higher_usage_occurrence is being specified. To ensure that the
and the
together constitute the entire path desired for the specified_higher_usage_occurrence, it is required that the instance of the
attribute of the
entity be the same as the instance of the
attribute of the
entity. The
attribute of the
shall reference the same instance as the
attribute of the specified_higher_usage_occurrence being specified. The
attribute of the
entity shall reference the same instance as the
attribute of the specified_higher_usage_occurrence being specified.
If the
referenced by the attribute upper_usage is not a
it shall be a specified_higher_usage_occurrence. This specified_higher_usage_occurrence shall have its attributes upper_usage and next_usage defined as described in the previous paragraph to specify further the path of the primary specified_higher_usage_occurrence. This recursive specification shall continue until the attribute upper_usage references an
entity that is a . At this point, the primary specified_higher_usage_occurrence is fully specified both in terms of its constituents/assembly relationship and the entire path between them.
The specified_higher_usage_occurrence is used to define portions of parts lists that contain a specific constituent within an assembly for which certain properties are to be associated or when the portion is used in more than one assembly structure.
Annex E contains examples of this entity and figures that depict the relationships between it and the other entities of this schema.

an
that is the same instance of the attribute
as this specified_higher_usage_occurrence and the same instance of the attribute
as the
of the
referenced by the attribute next_usage.

ext_description.p:
a
that is the same instance of the attribute
as this specified_higher_usage_occurrence and the same instance of the product definition referenced by the attribute
as the product definition referenced by the attribute
of the attribute upper_usage.
ext_description.note: See Figure E.7 for diagrams illustrating instances of these two attributes.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The instance of specified_higher_usage_occurrence shall not be the same as the instance of upper_usage.

The
attribute (i.e., assembly) of the specified_higher_usage_occurrence shall reference the same instance of
as the
(i.e., assembly) for the upper_usage.

The
attribute (i.e., constituent) of the specified_higher_usage_occurrence shall reference the same instance of
as the
for the next_usage.

The
(i.e., constituent) for the upper_usage shall reference, or be related to, the same instance of
as the
(i.e., assembly) for the next_usage.

The type of the upper_usage attribute shall be either
or specified_higher_usage_occurrence.
The combination of the upper_usage and next_usage attributes shall be unique within a population of specified_higher_usage_occurrence.

The unambiguously_specified_multi_level_reference_designator function determines whether a list of
is connected.
For each element in the links list, the
shall reference the same instance of
as the
of the next element in the list.
the list of s that shall be connected.
